data.title: Zac Efron Is Now a Yale Law Grad (Well, in His New Movie, at Least)
data.text:
In his two most recent roles—first in That Awkward Moment, and this month, in Neighbors—Zac Efron has played a party-loving bro who's great at having fun but far less successful at being a Big Kid with Real Responsibilities. He's clearly really, really good at playing a Peter Pan-inspired character, not to mention really cute at it (also: cute at everything else in general, but you already know that).

But to remind us all that he's a versatile actor—remember that time he played nice-guy Troy and sang love songs in High School Musical?—he's just signed on to star in and produce a law thriller based on John Grisham's bestseller The Associate. Zac will be a Yale Law School graduate (so smart!) who's blackmailed by a bunch of bad guys to spy on the world's largest law firm. In other words, the opposite of everything he's played in the past.

It's been awhile since we've seen a Grisham adaptation on the big screen, but if it's anything like The Client (which you should probably see) and The Rainmaker (which you should definitely see), it'll be worth a movie ticket. Besides, if nothing else, it's an hour-plus of Zac Efron. No brainer.
